page.title: 15BUCKFAST MILL
page.content: Wool arrives at the factory in large pressed_packed bales.These can sometimes weigh up to{1000}pounds. The wool is now ripped open and mixed together.This is known as blending. From here it is sent through a polythene pipe to be scoured.After it has been scoured it is sprayed lightly with a special wool oil.The next process is known as carding.This means that wool is rubbed in to a weak thread.From here it is spun which gives the wool extra strength.Now the single yarn is twisted with another piece and then it is wound onto skeins.This is known as hanking.The yarn is made in this way so that it may be strung onto rods and dipped into large vats to be dyed.From here the yarn is dryed in a large dryer.The last process is to put the yarn onto large cones which are then bagged.
